page_analysis.text_content:
Balconies, decks, & outdoor areas on upper floors

Outdoor areas on upper levels that are roofed DO count toward gross floor area regardless of the design (including whether or not the sides are open).

An outdoor area on an upper floor is considered to be roofed if the eave over that area is deeper than the eave over the rest of the building. This may be illustrated by comparing Roof Plans 1 & 2 of Fig 10.

Fig 10 Balconies

Roof plan 1
Roof plan 2

Note: Pop-out balconies are subject to the same evaluation.

Roof Plan 1 Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Does not count because this arbor is substantially open
Area C: Does not count because the overhang is the same size as the overhang around the rest of the house and is considered to be open

Width of overhang over the balcony

Width of overhang around the rest of the house

Roof Plan 2 Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Counts because the overhang here is greater than the overhang around the rest of the house, and considered to be roofed
Area C: Does not count because it is open

Width of overhang over the balcony

Width of overhang around the rest of the house

15

visual_elements.description: 3D isometric drawing of a two-story building with balconies, showing roof plan 1 and roof plan 2 with arrows pointing to different areas. The building has windows, doors, and multiple outdoor areas including balconies and decks.

Roof Plan 1 - Top-down view showing three areas labeled A, B, and C. Area A is shown with diagonal hatching, Area B has a grid pattern, and Area C is shown as an open area. Arrows indicate width measurements for overhangs.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, upper portion

visual_elements.description: Roof Plan 2 - Top-down view showing three areas labeled A, B, and C in different configuration than Plan 1. Area A is shown with diagonal hatching, Area B has diagonal hatching, and Area C is shown as an open area. Arrows indicate width measurements for overhangs.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, lower portion

structural_elements.main_heading: Balconies, decks, & outdoor areas on upper floors

additional_notes: Gray highlighted text box contains key rule about roofed outdoor areas
Dark gray note box at bottom left emphasizes pop-out balcony evaluation
Page number 15 appears at bottom right
Areas A, B, and C are clearly labeled in both roof plan diagrams
Measurement arrows show comparative overhang widths
